_header: Charles doughty knights ta le as they a wayward sped
_description: Sir Firumbras — in couplets (lines 1-3410) and 6-line stanzas (lines 3411-7130)

BodAsh33.First Lines:
Charlis doghti [knyȝtes] .. ta . le as þay a waywarde
                    speddeMo þan a þausend with out [ ] slowe þai as þay
                    fledde& drow hym [ ] wiþ on [ ] are with his host þat was
                    þereAc Olyuer was a woundede sare at þat tyme wiþ a
                    spere…
BodAsh33.Last Lines:
…Was non of hem þat ys flechs ne raasNoþer kyng ne
                    baroun ne non þat wasSche was so fair a þynge
BodAsh33.Note:
A corrected draft by the author of the opening lines appears on the
                    cover.
BodAsh33.Editions:
Herrtage,  Sidney John Hervon,
                        ed.  
             The English Charlemagne Romances I: Sir Ferumbras.
EETS
         e.s. 34 (1879); repr. 1966.
